title: Use Output and Feature Counts to Identify Problems

questions.question: If you receive no errors when running your workspace, the output must be correct.

You have connected two streams of data to a FeatureJoiner and are joining them using a common key attribute. After writing out the data, you notice your output looks incorrect. You receive no errors or warnings. Where might you look first to troubleshoot?
options: Check the FeatureJoiner output port feature counts. You might have chosen the wrong Join Mode or connected the wrong port.
Open the written data in its native application. Check for any warnings or errors there.

questions.question: How can you learn more about why features were rejected?
options: Inspecting the <Rejected> port and reading the fme_rejection_code attribute.
